entry.title: #TrayvonMartin you should be here celebrating; surrounded by...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#TrayvonMartin you should be here celebrating; surrounded by loved ones.

We lift your name and hold you and yours in our hearts forever.

The fight continues. #JusticeForTrayvonMartin #BlackLivesMatter #BlackHistoryMonth #SayHisName

The King Center is with Osvaldo Marcondes Azeredo Neto.

It’s your 26th birthday.
We remember you.
We mourn. And we work.
#TrayvonMartin

entry.title: Comment a 💜 if you wanna be like Dr. Alexander when you grow...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Comment a 💜 if you wanna be like Dr. Alexander when you grow up!

“She has that on-the-ground experience. She was out there with us at the protests all summer. She knows that trauma,” says Lipscomb, a friend and colleague since 2016. “But she can also apply that deeper analysis. I think that’s where the two worlds collide so beautifully in her. She knows that people are hurting, and she knows we need policy that makes space for us to heal.”

https://magazine.du.edu/keeping-the-peace/2/…

The police officer, grandmother & visionary Tracie Keesee did her time, so to speak. She joined the Denver Police Department in 1989, became its first African American commander, then its first female captain, then its first Black female division chief. She logged the hours in the classroom too,.....

magazine.du.edu

Keeping the peace | University of Denver Magazine

The police officer, grandmother & visionary Tracie Keesee did her time, so to speak. She joined the Denver Police Department in 1989, became its first African American commander, then its first female captain, then its first Black female division chief. She logged the hours in the classroom too,.....The police officer, grandmother & visionary Tracie Keesee did her time, so to speak. She joined the Denver Police Department in 1989, became its first African American commander, then its first female captain, then its first Black female division chief. She logged the hours in the classroom too,.....

entry.title: #CallToAction Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

#CallToAction Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and th...at is unacceptable.

❗️❗️❗️ Call his office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could’ve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid.

Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

See More

entry.title: Black Lives Matter at School is a national coalition organizing...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Black Lives Matter at School is a national coalition organizing for racial justice in education. We encourage all educators, students, parents, unions, and community organizations to join our annual week of action during the first week of February each year.​ This event will give us the opportunity to advocate and raise awareness on those in the community carrying the four demands as we continue the work in solidarity!

#BlackLivesMatter #BlackEducationIsRevolutionary #BLMAtSchoolWeek #blackhistorymonth2021

FRI, FEB 5

#BlackLivesMatter @ School Celebration

Online Event47 people interested

entry.title: Black Lives Matter 5280Shadae JenkinsThis month I want y’all to learn how to believe black women the first damn time Ghetto Black Women...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280Shadae Jenkins

This month I want y’all to learn how to believe black women the first damn time

Ghetto Black Women
Black Women with multiple children and baby daddies
Educated ...black women
Dropout black women
Vocation trained black women
Straight black women
Gay black women
Trans black women
Alternative black women
Nerdy black women
Hood black women
Suburban black women

Believe them. Practice beliving them this month so it becomes a permanent thing. Practice believing them before they post up or release 3,000 pieces of proof that they are right.

Thanks for coming to my TED talk

entry.title: ***Call for Action*** Despite public health consensus, Governor...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

***Call for Action***

Despite public health consensus, Governor Polis removed people in prison from the vaccine plan. He must stop the dangerous, political game he is playing with the lives of incarcerated people. Refusing to implement a prison vaccine plan will exacerbate COVID-19 suffering and its unequal impact on BIPOC communities. Over half the state’s prison population — 8,000 and counting — have been infected, with 28 deaths. Coloradans demand policies which value lives and achieve racial equity. Contact the Governor: acluco.org/Vaccine

entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Shocking.

It’s like #CounselorsNotCops but with less seasoning.

DPD Chief Pazen, who is fond of the STAR program, says it frees up officers to do their jobs: fight crime.

entry.title: MESSAGE:
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

MESSAGE:

Seeding Sovereignty

As mutual aid workers we know that often times addiction is the result of centuries of colonial trauma. Some coping is cheaper and easier to access, why is that...? And we know that the medical industrial complex never considered colonization as a health determinant. Until Indigenous peoples’ trauma can be acknowledged and central in care work, communities will continue to suffer from addiction. But also... honoring agency and autonomy means that it doesn’t matter the conditions, everyone deserves a home, food, water, and whatever it takes to keep them alive and comfortable.

Art from @deardarlingdesignstudio

Image ID:
Over a light pink background, text in a groovy retro font reads, “People don’t need to be sober to deserve food, shelter and kindness.”

See More

entry.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
entry.content:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
